perturbation.original_text: Fees due to Licensor from invoices rendered by Licensee during the first year of the term hereof will be payable one hundred and twenty (120) days after the date of the Licensee's invoice to a Redistributor or Customer, as the case may be.  Fees due to Licensor from invoices rendered on or after the first day of the thirteenth (13th) month through and including the last day of the eighteenth (18th) month of the term hereof will be payable ninety (90) days after the date of such invoice.  Fees due to Licensor from invoices rendered thereafter will be payable sixty (60) days after the date of such invoice.
perturbation.changed_text: Fees due to Licensor from invoices rendered by Licensee during the first year of the term hereof will be payable one hundred and twenty (120) days after the date of the Licensee's invoice to a Redistributor or Customer, as the case may be. Fees due to Licensor from invoices rendered on or after the first day of the thirteenth (13th) month through and including the last day of the eighteenth (18th) month of the term hereof will be payable thirty (30) days after the date of such invoice. Fees due to Licensor from invoices rendered thereafter will be payable sixty (60) days after the date of such invoice.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces an in-text contradiction by changing the payment terms from 90 days to 30 days for invoices rendered during a specific period. This creates ambiguity about the actual payment deadline, leading to potential disputes.

perturbation.original_text: Licensor reserves the right to reject any product order, to cancel any  product orders placed by Licensee and accepted by Licensor and to refuse or  delay shipment thereof if Licensee fails to make any payments as provided in  this Agreement or otherwise continues to fail to comply with the terms and  conditions of this Agreement for thirty (30) days after delivery of written notice of such failure.
perturbation.changed_text: Licensor reserves the right to reject any product order, to cancel any product orders placed by Licensee and accepted by Licensor and to refuse or delay shipment thereof if Licensee fails to make any payments as provided in this Agreement or otherwise continues to fail to comply with the terms and conditions of this Agreement for fifteen (15) days after delivery of written notice of such failure.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces an in-text contradiction by changing the grace period for compliance from 30 days to 15 days after written notice. This creates ambiguity about the time frame within which the Licensee must rectify any failures to comply with the agreement, potentially leading to disputes about order fulfillment and termination rights.

perturbation.original_text: For twelve (12) months after delivery of any Licensed Product to a Customer, whether Customer receives such Licensed Product from Licensee or a Redistributor, Licensor warrants that each Licensed Product will perform as described in the applicable Documentation.
perturbation.changed_text: For six (6) months after delivery of any Licensed Product to a Customer, whether Customer receives such Licensed Product from Licensee or a Redistributor, Licensor warrants that each Licensed Product will perform as described in the applicable Documentation.
perturbation.explanation: The change in the warranty period from twelve months to six months creates an inconsistency. The ambiguity about the warranty period can lead to disputes regarding the duration of the warranty coverage.
